name: places/ChIJO8EBSw9ZwokRmcfn86E87h0
adrFormatAddress: 576 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
I have been going to this particular branch for several years.  But not anymore!!!
I called on a Sunday asking if there will be a notary on premises on Monday and if I need an appointment.  The girl on the other line with street slang reassured me that there will be one and NO APPOINTMENT needed.
Well…I arrived on a Monday at 1 pm with two forms to be signed and notarized.
There was only one customer at the tellers. And me in the mid of the bank asking for notary.  Three people sitting at desks.  Diana Rivera, notary asks we what I needed, when I told her notary and explained about my phone call day before…she gave me an attitude.  She didn’t tell me to sit down, I stood in mid of bank for two min.  When I finally asked if I should sit she nodes without even looking up at me.  She was so rude, unprofessional, mean and disrespectful, I just could not believe the treatment I was getting.
She ended up helping me after a 10 min wait.  Nobody in the bank!!!  Still with a rude attitude of me not having an appointment, she was too busy but is helping me as a courtesy and if I knew this service was free.  She ended up repeating the free service and her giving curtesy treatment five times during our 5 min interaction.  I thanked her for her signatures and seal and walked out shaking.  In uttering disbelief this has happened.  I called supervisor, he was at lunch, afterwards left two messages, and now have waited 24 hours, still no phone call back.  Will never go back.  Customer service in this branch is nonexistent.  You are treated with unprofessional and rude staff.  Disappointed overall.

originalText.text: I was looking all around NYC today to get papers notarized.  Many places were either closed or not doing notarization anymore.  I was relief when I met Johnathan Santos in this TD bank location.  He was very considerate and understanding of this difficult time with Covid.  I got my paper notarized and no charge.  Thank you so much.

text.text: I was looking all around NYC today to get papers notarized.  Many places were either closed or not doing notarization anymore.  I was relief when I met Johnathan Santos in this TD bank location.  He was very considerate and understanding of this difficult time with Covid.  I got my paper notarized and no charge.  Thank you so much.

originalText.text:
Totally had a bad experience at this location. My wife had problems with her new TD account and without a good explanations, she was notified that her account is being closed. At the initial location we went to open the account (TD on Flatlands) we had a reasonable experience. The manager really tried to explain the situation and he did his utmost best to help and retain us and I appreciate him for that. I thought that I would get the same good experience at all the TD branches, but NO THAT IS NOT THE CASE.

At the TD Bank on 2nd avenue, this employee, a guy who is a customer representative (at least I think he is), once you walk in the bank, he sits in a room on the left, TOTALLY DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO TREAT CUSTOMERS.  It did not happen one time, but 2 times and it is a shame for the company. You have those who do their utmost best to help customers and those who don't even care. So in the end I just closed my account.

TD corporate, a message to you: train those of all branches better who don't know how to treat their customers and do appreciate those who know how....really disappointed, my first Bank in the US, and I had a bad experience.

originalText.text:
This Murray Hill TD Bank location is one of the newer ones.  I was so excited to see it open since it's only 2 blocks from my job.
It's small but rarely is there a long wait on line.   The tellers are always very friendly.  There are usually at least 2 - 3 customer service agents.
Like all other TD's this location is open 7 days a week and has the coin machine.

originalText.text: I have been banking with TD bank for 12 years every since I was with commerce and it merged to TD Bank.  In all my years I  deposit my paycheck the day before and was allotted $100 minimum which most of the time I don't really take out.  I encountered this shady Teller all I wanted was $40 from what i am allotted she said I have to wait until Friday (but wait the entire check hits the account on Friday  and the day b4 u are allotted 100) she says they do this as a courtesy..Well I have never heard of this courtesy for the past 12yrs! She said because the check is dated for the next day.. one of the workers that been there longer then her didn't even back me up. I called TD Bank themselves and they said what the tellers on TD Bank Kips Bay nyc was  false how i am allotted at least the 100 soon  as I deposit it. I may continue to bank with TD Idk yet but I will never go to that branch again in life and didn't appreciate as loyal as I am to TD bank and going to that branch in particular how the veteran Teller didn't back me up at all and stabbed me right in the back! As for that shady teller giving me a hard time when she isn't reciting correct procedure and policy you was unprofessional with no care of losing customers.  I'm extremely disappointed I know my rights and this wasn't justified!
